intro: Dioscorea multiflora var. concepcionis, commonly known as the Concepción yam, is a climbing vine native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by cylindrical, yellowish fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. This variety is valued for its edible tubers, which are rich in starch and have been traditionally used in local cuisines.
